title: How to Paint Warhammer 40,000

steps.headline: Assemble your models for the undercoat.
steps.description: You can do this easily by spray painting them. Undercoating must be done in black or white paint. This depends on whether or not the colours you are using are light colours or not. For colours such as oranges and yellows use white undercoating and for colours such as blues and purples use black.

steps.headline: Once the undercoat is done, paint over your model, as completely as possible, with your chosen foundation colour.
Over top of your foundation(s) use your colour(s) to paint the main face of your model.
Use a Citadel wash/ink to get in the cracks of your models.
Go over any places you un-intentionally got the wash on
Clean up any part of the models that either weren't covered completely, or that got a bit of the wrong paint on them.
Make sure your model has no fault or anything.
You have finished your model and are ready to wage war across the galaxy!

text: Assemble your models for the undercoat. You can do this easily by spray painting them. Undercoating must be done in black or white paint. This depends on whether or not the colours you are using are light colours or not. For colours such as oranges and yellows use white undercoating and for colours such as blues and purples use black. Once the undercoat is done, paint over your model, as completely as possible, with your chosen foundation colour.  Over top of your foundation(s) use your colour(s) to paint the main face of your model.  Use a Citadel wash/ink to get in the cracks of your models.  Go over any places you un-intentionally got the wash on  Start your detailing work  Clean up any part of the models that either weren't covered completely, or that got a bit of the wrong paint on them.  Make sure your model has no fault or anything.  You have finished your model and are ready to wage war across the galaxy! For the Emperor! Semper Fortitudo! !
